business.headline: Sensex opens 184 points lower, Nifty below 26,150; Titan up 3%Sensex opens 184 points lower, Nifty below 26,150; Titan up 3%

Gold and silver rates today: Buy, wait or sell?Gold prices in India were largely steady on January 7, 2026, with only a marginal rise seen across purity levels. As per the latest data, 24K gold was priced at Rs 13,883 per gram, up by Rs 1.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO to open soon: Latest GMP update for investorsThe price band for the IPO of Bharat Coking Coal has been fixed at Rs 21 to Rs 23 per share. The lot size is 600 shares. Based on the upper price band, a retail investor will need to invest at least Rs 13,800 for one lot.

Reliance sees worst session since June 2024. What should investors do now?Reliance Industries shares closed 4.5% lower at Rs 1,507.6, marking their steepest decline since June 4, 2024. During the session, the stock slipped as much as 5.1% to Rs 1,496.30, hitting its lowest level since November 11, as selling pressure intensified.
Sensex ends 376 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; RIL tanks 4%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 376.28 points to close at 85,063.34, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 71.60 points to end at 26,178.70.

Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL found in breach of antitrust laws: ReportThe Competition Commission of India has also held 56 top executives liable for price collusion over different periods between 2015 and 2023.

Why US–Venezuela tensions have global markets watching oil and goldTensions between the US and Venezuela are worrying markets because oil supplies and economic stability could be affected if the situation worsens. Here's all you need to know.

Reliance share price crashes 5%: Is it good time to buy the stock?RIL share price: The stock opened slightly lower at Rs 1,575.55 and remained under selling pressure through the session. At the time of writing, the share price was at Rs 1,509, down Rs 68.45 or 4.34%.

Is Venezuela the trigger, or is gold and silver's rally bigger than geopolitics?In India, MCX gold is trading at a lifetime high. A decisive breakout could push prices sharply higher, while lower levels continue to attract buyers rather than panic sellers. MCX silver, trading over Rs 2.5 lakh, remains in an uptrend as long as key support zones hold.

Cupid share price rebounds sharply, up 9% today. Here's whyThe rebound follows a brutal sell-off on Monday, when the stock plunged nearly 20% after a large block deal weighed on sentiment and triggered aggressive profit-booking.

HDFC Bank share price falls over 2% after Q3 business updateHDFC Bank shares were among the top drags on benchmark indices as selling pressure intensified, even as the broader market traded lower in early deals.

Reliance share price down over 4%. Why is it falling today?The fall in Reliance shares comes against the backdrop of a broader market correction. Both the Sensex and the Nifty traded lower in early deals as investors turned cautious on global cues and reduced exposure to heavyweight stocks.

Trent shares fall 8%: Why is the stock falling today, and should you buy?Trent share price: The stock opened lower at Rs 4,219.90 and slipped further to an intraday low of Rs 4,060.65, close to its 52-week low of Rs 3,931.45.
Sensex opens 150 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 238.67 points to 85,200.95, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.15 points to 26,193.15 as of 9:22 am.

Reliance Industries denies report on Russian oil deliveries to Jamnagar refineryReliance clarified that its Jamnagar refinery has not received any cargo of Russian oil in the past three weeks. The company also said it is not expecting any deliveries of Russian crude oil in January.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Price band out, does GMP point to 50% listing gains?Bharat Coking Coal IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 1,071.11 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale of 46.57 crore shares, with no fresh issue component.

US plans talks with oil companies on boosting Venezuela output after Maduro ousterThe meetings are crucial to the administration's hopes of getting top US oil companies back into the South American nation after its government, nearly two decades ago, took control of US-led energy operations there.
Sensex closes 322 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 322.39 points to close at 85,439.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 78.25 points to end at 26,250.30.

What worries RBI about India's insurance sector despite its stability?The RBI highlights that the insurance sector is systemically important because of its size, its role as a long-term investor, and its growing links with the wider financial system.

How investors can manage short-term uncertainty with digital gold, ETFs and SGBsFrom an investment perspective, buying physical gold may no longer be the most efficient choice. When purchasing physical gold, investors must pay 3% GST upfront, which immediately impacts returns.

entertainment.headline: Nick Jonas can't get Priyanka-Sunil Grover's trending track out of his head. Watch Nick Jonas shared a video on Instagram grooving to Priyanka Chopra and Sunil Grover's viral song from The Great Indian Kapil Show. Fans reacted enthusiastically to the couple's playful interaction.

No alimony: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban settle divorce after 19 years Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban have officially ended their 19-year marriage, agreeing to a joint parenting plan for their daughters and waiving alimony and child support claims.

What I saw in Jaisalmer: Jawans' love for Sunny Deol A first-hand account from Jaisalmer, where the launch of Border 2's song Ghar Kab Aaoge revealed the deep, lasting bond between Sunny Deol and the Indian armed forces.

Watch: SRK and Rohit Sharma's candid chat at Mumbai event thrills fans Shah Rukh Khan and Rohit Sharma were seen sharing a conversation at the United in Triumph event in Mumbai, sparking significant attention and admiration across social media platforms.

Delhi High Court orders blocking 160 sites streaming Friends, Stranger Things The Delhi High Court has ordered the blocking of more than 160 piracy websites following a plea by Warner Bros Entertainment Inc, aiming to protect the company's copyrighted shows and movies from illegal online distribution.

Deepika Padukone's bodyguard treats fans with rare pic on her 40th birthday A rare photo shared by Deepika Padukone with her bodyguard drew attention on the actor's 40th birthday, as fans and industry colleagues joined in to celebrate the occasion.

Salman Khan never second-guesses himself, says Chitrangda Singh. Exclusive Chitrangda Singh has sharesd screen space with Salman Khan in Battle of Galwan. She spoke to India Today about her experience of working with the superstar, calling it an unexpected yet rewarding collaboration.

Jujutsu Kaisen returns with Culling Games part 1. Okkutsu kills Itadori Yuji? The first part of Jujutsu Kaisen season three is set to premiere on January 8, and the season openers are worth all the anticipation. The season, titled Culling Games, starts off with Yuji being on the hunt by special grade sorcerers.

SRK is the GOAT, but I love Deepika: Sophie Turner shares love for Bollywood 'Game of Thrones' actor Sophie Turner has joined the long list of international stars who have openly admired Bollywood, showering praise on Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone.

The Hunt for Gollum: McKellen shares major update about new Lord of the Rings film Sir Ian McKellen is set to reunite with Frodo Baggins in Andy Serkis' new 'The Lord of the Rings' film 'The Hunt for Gollum'. The movie will mark the much-awaited return of these two pivotal characters.

Watch: Hardik Pandya introduces girlfriend Mahieka Sharma to Amitabh Bachchan Cricketer Hardik Pandya's introduction of his model girlfriend Mahieka Sharma to Amitabh Bachchan during a Mumbai event has captured widespread attention online.

The Judge Returns review: Ji Sung's legal drama tests patience early onRelease Date:Thu Jan 02, 2025 The Judge Returns follows a judge who wakes up ten years in the past to correct his mistakes. The series blends political corruption with a time-reset twist but struggles with pacing and tone.

I don't know Kartik, says Karina Kubiliute's Insta bio after link-up buzz Amid rumours that she is dating Kartik Aaryan after photos from the actor's Goa trip went viral, Karina Kubiliute has updated her Instagram bio to deny knowing him.

Avengers Doomsday teaser: X-Men take centre stage in fourth preview Marvel Studios released the fourth teaser for Avengers: Doomsday on Tuesday. It gave fans their first look at the X-Men's integration into the Marvel Cinematic Universe and promised significant crossover moments.

Jack Black says rejecting The Incredibles is his biggest career regret Actor Jack Black has said that he regrets turning down 'The Incredibles' (2004) and calling it one of his favourite films. He will next be seen in 'The Super Mario Galaxy Movie' (2026).

Jeethu Joseph's Drishyam 3 to release in April, ahead of Ajay Devgn's Hindi version Director Jeethu Joseph confirmed the release of his crime-thriller 'Drishyam 3' in April 2026. The film features Mohanlal in the lead role.

Bigg Boss 19 reunion in Dubai: Gaurav, Ashnoor, Awez party as Amaal, Farrhana skip Contestants from Bigg Boss 19, including winner Gaurav Khanna, gathered in Dubai for a reunion party weeks after the show's finale. Meanwhile, Amaal Mallik and Farrhana Bhatt skipped the gathering.

Yami Gautam thanks fans as Haq gets positive response on OTT Yami Gautam Dhar expressed gratitude to fans after Haq received a positive response following its OTT release on Netflix. The film, which also stars Emraan Hashmi, explores themes of gender, justice and women's rights.

Dhurandhar 2 to have another Flipperachi song? Fa9la singer replies Fa9la by Flipperachi became an instant hit following Akshaye Khanna's entry in Dhurandhar. The singer has now hinted in an exclusive conversation that the song may feature in Dhurandhar 2 as well.

general news.headline: Stones thrown at cops during pre-dawn Delhi demolition drive, protesters tear-gassed Live UpdatesTensions flared briefly in Old Delhi's Turkman Gate area when people tried to breach barricades and threw stones at police during a pre-dawn demolition drive to clear encroachments near a mosque. Police responded by firing tear gas, dispersing the crowd and restoring order.

ICC rejects Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of IndiaThe ICC has turned down Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India, sources tell India Today. The decision deepens tensions after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit and security concerns raised by BCB.

India has good ties with Venezuela, concerned with situation there: JaishankarExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said India is concerned about the developments in Venezuela, where the US captured then-President Nicolas Maduro and his wife last weekend. He urged all parties to reach a peaceful solution that protects the interests of the Venezuelan people.

I will be impeached if Republicans don't win 2026 midterms: Donald TrumpFollowing the capture of Nicolas Maduro, calls for Trump's impeachment have turned shriller, with Democratic lawmakers and political figures stepping up demands for action.

Deepika Padukone's bodyguard treats fans with rare pic on her 40th birthdayA rare photo shared by Deepika Padukone with her bodyguard drew attention on the actor's 40th birthday, as fans and industry colleagues joined in to celebrate the occasion.

Live: 6 protesters detained as demolition drive near Delhi mosque turns violentDelhi Demolition Drive Live Updates: A pre-dawn demolition drive by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi near the Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque at Turkman Gate triggered brief tensions on Wednesday after miscreants pelted stones at police personnel. The action, carried out under Delhi High Court orders to remove encroachments near Ramlila Maidan, saw police use minimal force, including tear gas, to restore order. Five officers suffered minor injuries. Authorities clarified the mosque was untouched, and traffic restrictions remain in place. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates-

36 dead in Iran's anti-Khamenei protests, exiled prince Pahlavi calls for actionProtests over economic hardship continue across Iran, with at least 36 protesters killed and more than 1,000 arrested as security forces crack down on demonstrations centred around Tehran and western provinces.

After 24-day battle, AIIMS Bhopal doctor dies of alleged anaesthesia overdoseAccording to police, Dr Verma had returned home after completing her duty on December 11, when she allegedly administered herself a high dose of anaesthesia. She died on Monday after battling for life for 24 days.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 11 | Tolkappiyar: The Creator of the Akam–Puram ArchitectureThe author of Tolkappiyam, Tolkappiyar, may be regarded as one of the earliest anthropologists of the ancient world.

US to get 30-50 million barrels of Venezuelan oil, I'll control proceeds: TrumpDonald Trump said Venezuela's interim authorities will hand over 30 to 50 million barrels of sanctioned oil to the US, with proceeds controlled by him to benefit both countries.

How data nulls Trump's claim of drugs flowing into US from VenezuelaUS President Donald Trump said that Venezuelan leader Nicholas Maduro was arrested on charges of drug trafficking and narco-terrorism against Americans. However, a look at available data says that the cocaine produced in Venezuela is mostly pushed into Europe. The vast majority of cocaine and synthetic drugs in the US come from Mexico and Colombia.

Hindi heartland should follow Tamil Nadu model, says ex-Chief Economic AdvisorFormer Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian said the Hindi heartland should emulate Tamil Nadu's development model, pointing to the state's strong record in attracting investment and managing economic risks more effectively than others.

Bus ride from London to Calcutta for £145: The 110-day route that once existedLondon to Calcutta, or vice versa, the bus service that operated in the 1960s and 70s offered passengers an unforgettable journey across multiple countries and continents. The 110-day route eventually came to an end due to growing instability in the Middle East.

PM not happy with me over steep tariffs: Trump on strained ties with IndiaDonald Trump noted the strain in ties while insisting that India has sharply cut back its oil imports from Russia. He said Prime Minister Modi was not happy because India is now "paying a lot of tariffs" as a result of US policy.

Delhi-NCR shivers as cold wave tightens grip, schools shut; AQI slips to very poorDelhi-NCR is grappling with severe cold and dense fog, causing visibility issues and health concerns due to very poor air quality. Authorities have taken precautionary measures including school closures to ensure public safety amid the harsh winter conditions.

No alimony: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban settle divorce after 19 yearsNicole Kidman and Keith Urban have officially ended their 19-year marriage, agreeing to a joint parenting plan for their daughters and waiving alimony and child support claims.

Closer look at new Chinese structures near Pangong Lake and what they meanHigh-resolution satellite imagery shows the permanent nature of new Chinese structures coming up close to the Pangong Tso buffer zone.

Trump unpopular, unlike Modi: Ian Bremmer says US President's actions can be undoneGeopolitical expert Ian Bremmer noted that, unlike India - where PM Modi has ruled for 10 years and counting due to his popularity - Trump's tenure is limited. On Venezuela, he warned that Trump's successor could undo much of what he has done, just as Trump did with his predecessor.

Lionel Messi gets candid in fun interview, opens up on AI use and being 'weird'Lionel Messi peeled back the layers in a rare, fun-filled interview, speaking openly about solitude, routines and modern technology. From AI to social media, the football icon showed a refreshingly human side.

So Maduro's dance moves really did irk Trump after allUS President Donald Trump revealed Melania Trump's disapproval of his rally dance moves. Despite criticism, Trump insists his performances are popular with supporters. He also accused Nicolas Maduro of imitating his dancing.

Did Eleven in Stranger Things end up at this great travel destination?SPOILER ALERT: Stranger Things has drawn the curtains, leaving fans wondering about Eleven's fate. While theories continue to swirl, wanderlust has taken over for some, prompting them to backpack to a remote waterfall they believe may be where Eleven found her ending.

I don't know Kartik, says Karina Kubiliute's Insta bio after link-up buzzAmid rumours that she is dating Kartik Aaryan after photos from the actor's Goa trip went viral, Karina Kubiliute has updated her Instagram bio to deny knowing him.

After IPL exit, Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman joins Pakistan Super LeagueMustafizur Rahman has joined the Pakistan Super League shortly after being released from the IPL. The Bangladesh pacer's move follows KKR's decision to end his contract amid tensed cross-country relations.

Trump discussed Greenland acquisition, military option open: White HouseThe White House also made clear that military involvement has not been ruled out. It said the use of the US armed forces is "always an option" available to the US President Donald Trump as discussions continue.

sports.headline: Ashes: Ben Stokes injured in Sydney as England's tour goes from bad to worse England's Ashes misery deepened in Sydney after Ben Stokes limped off injured on Day 4. The captain's groin problem added to England's growing list of concerns in a tour slipping further away.

With LA 28 qualification in sight, can India move on from Manpreet Singh? As India chase Asian Games gold and LA Olympics qualification, Manpreet Singh's fitness, experience and versatility remain irreplaceable. But with his future now under cloud, can Indian hockey afford to move on from their veteran dynamic midfielder?

ICC rejects Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India The ICC has turned down Bangladesh's request to move T20 World Cup matches out of India, sources tell India Today. The decision deepens tensions after Mustafizur Rahman's IPL exit and security concerns raised by BCB.

Lionel Messi gets candid in fun interview, opens up on AI use and being 'weird' Lionel Messi peeled back the layers in a rare, fun-filled interview, speaking openly about solitude, routines and modern technology. From AI to social media, the football icon showed a refreshingly human side.

Malaysia Open live score: PV Sindhu wins opening round in straight games Malaysia Open 2026 live score and updates: PV Sindhu has made a winning start to the 2026 season. The World No. 18 beats Sung Shuao Yun of Chinese Taipei in straight games to move into the second round of the Super 1000 tournament. Earlier on Tuesday, Lakshya Sen and Ayush Shetty won their first round in men's singles.

After IPL exit, Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman joins Pakistan Super League Mustafizur Rahman has joined the Pakistan Super League shortly after being released from the IPL. The Bangladesh pacer's move follows KKR's decision to end his contract amid tensed cross-country relations.

New Zealand announce spin-heavy T20 World Cup squad, include in-form RCB pacer New Zealand named a spin-focused T20 World Cup squad built for Indian conditions and experience ahead of tournament. In-form pacer Jacob Duffy headlines selection after record-breaking year and maiden global tournament call-up with deserved reward.

Glenn Phillips turns left-handed: Is this NZ's secret plan for World Cup? New Zealand's Glenn Phillips is a unique player. He bats, bowls, keeps and is an incredible fielder on the boundary rope. Right-hander Phillips seems to have added one more weapon in his arsenal, batting left-handed.

Historic 1st as SG Pipers opt to field 9 Indian stars in Women's Hockey India League In a historic first in the Women's Hockey India League, the SG Pipers named nine Indian players in their starting XI for the clash against Shrachi Bengal Tigers on Tuesday, January 6. The Pipers went down fighting in the game in a sudden-death shootout.

After IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman unfazed by India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup saga After his controversial IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman appears to be unfazed by all the noise surrounding the India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup row. Bangladesh have refused to send their team to India for the upcoming ICC event.

No need for split coaching in Indian cricket at the moment: HarbhajanFormer India cricketer Harbhajan Singh does not want split coaching in the Indian team. Harbhajan has backed Gautam Gambhir as questions continue to loom about his red-ball credentials.

Ole back at Manchester United? Solskjaer seen in amidst return rumoursAmist Manchester United return rumours, Ole Gunnar Solksjaer was spotted in Cheshire on Tuesday, January 6. Solksjaer is considered to be United's top target for the interim manager role until the end of the season.

Controversial spinner Lamichhane headlines Nepal's 15-member T20 World Cup squadSandeep Lamichhane will be spearheading Nepal's spin attack as they reveal the 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 on Tuesday, January 6. Rohit Paudel will be leading the side with Dipendra Airee acting as his deputy.

ICC unmoved, set to request Bangladesh to play T20 World Cup in India: ReportThe International Cricket Council wants Bangladesh to play its group-stage matches in India. The international body was expected to host a meeting with the Bangladesh Cricket Board on Tuesday.

Pep Guardiola makes Manchester United claim after Amorim sacking: Close to ArsenalPep Guardiola has claimed that Manchester United could have been close to Arsenal in the Premier League title race had a handful of results gone their way before the club sacked manager Ruben Amorim.

ISL to start from February 14, all clubs to participate: Sports MinisterSports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya announced on Tuesday that the Indian Super League (ISL), which had been put on hold due to the lack of a commercial partner, will resume from February 14.

Watch: Rohit Sharma continues no vada pav policy, declines fan's offer in MumbaiRohit Sharma has rejected his favourite vada pav once again as he declined the offer from a fan politely while training ahead of the India vs New Zealand ODIs in Mumbai on Tuesday, January 6.

Pant's lack of ODI game time irks Ex-India batter: He is a generational talentFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra has raised concerns about the Indian selectors' handling of wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant in the ODI squad, pointing out the lack of playing opportunities for Pant since 2024 despite his inclusion against New Zealand.

Pretty s**t stat: Travis Head turns press room into comedy club in SydneyAshes 2025-26: Travis Head lit up the SCG with a breathtaking century and then carried the entertainment into the press room, delighting journalists with humour, honesty and effortless charm after another Ashes masterclass.

India has a doping problem: Full list of athletes who tested positive in 2025India has a doping problem. Several athletes across disciplines were suspended after testing positive for banned substances last year. Here's the full list.

Sri Lanka vs Pakistan T20I series Live Streaming: Squads and all you need to knowThe Sri Lanka–Pakistan T20I series in Dambulla from January 7–11 serves as a key World Cup 2026 warm-up, allowing both teams to test combinations, assess depth and fine-tune strategies in familiar conditions.

Brendon McCullum may quit as coach if England give post-Ashes ultimatum: ReportBrendon McCullum may reportedly quit as the coach of the England and Wales cricket board gives him an ultimatum to make sweeping changes to the team's environment and culture. The ECB review has started on England's poor Ashes series.

Solskjaer considered for shock Manchester United return after Amorim sacking: ReportOle Gunnar Solskjaer is reportedly being considered for a return as Manchester United's caretaker head coach following the sacking of Ruben Amorim, as the club searches for stability during a turbulent period.

Mustafizur Rahman IPL snub: Bangladesh fans claim KKR have lost followersThe Mustafizur Rahman controversy has triggered a backlash from Bangladesh, with fans claiming to have boycotted KKR, the government banning IPL telecasts, and the BCB refusing to play T20 World Cup matches in India while seeking ICC intervention.

Once hailed as swift as MS Dhoni, England great joins Gujarat Giants as fielding coachEngland legend Sarah Taylor joins Gujarat Giants as fielding coach for the Women's Premier League 2026, bringing world-class experience to strengthen the team's fielding and overall performance.

Chelsea appoint Liam Rosenior as new head coach, given lengthy contractChelsea have confirmed the appointment of Liam Rosenior as their new head coach, replacing Enzo Maresca. Rosenior impressed everyone with his work with RC Strasbourg in France and joins the Blues on a lengthy contract.

Shubman Gill trolled after Vijay Hazare Trophy failure vs Goa: Flat track bullyIndia ODI captain Shubman Gill was mercilessly trolled after failing on his return to domestic cricket. Playing against Goa, Gill was dismissed for only 11 runs by Vasuki Koushik.

Indian women would be hard to beat in future: Ashleigh Gardner reveals scary prospectAustralia all-rounder Ashleigh Gardner revealed that the Indian women's team would be hard to beat in the near future as their meteoric rise continued with the Women's World Cup win at home last year.

Tactician Meg Lanning runs into uncharted territory to change UP Warriorz fateFormer Australian captain Meg Lanning has a huge task in hand as UP Warriorz look to recover and make an impact in the Women's Premier League (WPL) after finishing at the bottom of the table last time around.

Malaysia Open: 20-year-old Ayush Shetty knocks out home favourite in 1st RoundMalaysia Open 2026: 20-year-old Ayush Shetty defeated local favourite Lee Zii Jia 21-12, 21-17 in the first round of men's singles at the Super 1000 event in Kuala Lumpur. He joined Lakshya Sen in the second round of the season-opening event.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
